formattedAddress: 1 World Trade Center, New York, NY 10007, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1 World Trade Center, New York, NY 10007, USA

originalText.text:
Absurdly dissatisfied with Capital RX. They are our new insurance as of the beginning of 2024 and denied coverage for my medication, which I have been on for years!!! I have never had a problem with this medication.

I do, however, have major issues without it. Not just the pain for which it is prescribed, but the last time I had insurance problems and couldn't get it I developed severe insomnia for 11 days, which is one of the withdrawal symptoms of this medication.

To tell someone that they can no longer have a medicine they have been on for years that has MAJOR WITHDRAWAL SYMPTOMS is not only ridiculous, it is insanely dangerous. Will be calling them today to find out any recourse I have available, but so far this company has been a major bust and if they continue to deny coverage I will be switching insurance companies next week when I start a new job with insurance available on day 1.

Thanks for being just another garbage insurance company that cares more about money than people.

originalText.text: Complete joke of a pharmaceutical company to think they can help the American people with proper coverage. They only seem to cover what they feel is appropriate and for some of us (Type 1 diabetic) they only cover what they "want" and they provide no communication. If you need more of the medication you need, they want prior authorizations for EVERYTHING! Very frustrating to say the least.

text.text: Complete joke of a pharmaceutical company to think they can help the American people with proper coverage. They only seem to cover what they feel is appropriate and for some of us (Type 1 diabetic) they only cover what they "want" and they provide no communication. If you need more of the medication you need, they want prior authorizations for EVERYTHING! Very frustrating to say the least.

originalText.text: Just another leach on America's broken health "care" system that exists to make getting your medications covered as difficult as possible. Have a prescription from your doctor? Not good enough. Capital Rx wants your doctor to prove to them that you need that medicine. Need it in a hurry? Well you can always pay out-of-pocket. Good luck getting reimbursed!

Not good enough. Capital Rx wants your doctor to prove to them that you need that medicine. Need it in a hurry? Well you can always pay out-of-pocket. Good luck getting reimbursed!

originalText.text: ZERO STARS. My doctor prescribed medication and they denied the request. Placed appeal and they denied again. Request took 3 days even when marked urgent by doctor. They only snail mail responses which delays the process further. What is the point of having a patient portal?

originalText.text: Capital RX does not have Zepbound on their formulary list and I have a scrip and the pharmacy has it. The rep said it can take 6 months to get on the list. My friends who have other prescription plans have already had their prescription company approve and help pay for this medication! I am very disappointed!!
